@Game_Master1 wrote:

[quote=“super_, post:5, topic:403698”]… what?
the point is you borked your transforms and it ends up modifying eja.a(int, java.awt.Component) to fail the verification data-flow analysis
i don’t know why you just pasted a list of return instructions[/quote]

I’ve got it to work with the injected.jar, for some reason the problem was when I added superclass changes. Anyways, its loading HD and I don’t want it to load HD and more problems occur when I try to call the getPlayerName().

item.title: Running the injected runescape.jar
item.dc:creator: @Game_Master1 Game Master
item.description:
@Game_Master1 wrote:

FIXED ALL ERRORS(FOR SOME REASON IT WAS THE CHANGING OF SUPERCLASS)

Now, i got a few other problems:

  • Im running the injected runescape.jar, I was wondering how do I load it in signed mode(not HD)
  • I’m trying to display playerName in my command prompt when im on the game and I get this extreme error:

In the gif image above, I extract the injected jar and i open the obfuscated class for player in the 657 client and i show the interface and the accessor methods…

Im just wondering how do i call these methods.

Here is my code when i click “Show PlayerNames”


		if (menu.equals("Debug")) {
            if (option.equals("Display PlayerName")) {
				System.out.println(getmyName());
            }
		}

which is leaded to

	public static String getmyName() {
		return player.getPlayerName();
	}

which leads to


package org.multi.client;

public interface Player extends Mobile {
    public String getPlayerName();
    public String getDisplayName();
    PlayerDef getDef();
}

Read full topic
